headline: Two Chinese nationals in California accused of illegally shipping Nvidia AI chips to China
summary: (Reuters) -Two Chinese nationals were arrested in California and charged with illegally shipping tens of millions of dollars' worth of AI chips to China, including Nvidia H100s, the U.S. Justice Department said Tuesday.  Chuan Geng, 28, of Pasadena, and Shiwei Yang, 28, of El Monte, exported the advanced Nvidia chips and other technology to China from October 2022 through July 2025 without obtaining the required licenses from the U.S. Commerce Department, a criminal complaint says.  According to the complaint, Geng and Yang's El Monte-based company, ALX Solutions Inc, was founded in 2022, shortly after the U.S. imposed sweeping export controls on technology to China and began to require licenses for the chips.

raw.headline: Two Chinese nationals in California accused of illegally shipping Nvidia AI chips to China
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Two Chinese nationals were arrested in California and charged with illegally shipping tens of millions of dollars' worth of AI chips to China, including Nvidia H100s, the U.S. Justice Department said Tuesday.  Chuan Geng, 28, of Pasadena, and Shiwei Yang, 28, of El Monte, exported the advanced Nvidia chips and other technology to China from October 2022 through July 2025 without obtaining the required licenses from the U.S. Commerce Department, a criminal complaint says.  According to the complaint, Geng and Yang's El Monte-based company, ALX Solutions Inc, was founded in 2022, shortly after the U.S. imposed sweeping export controls on technology to China and began to require licenses for the chips.

headline: Nvidia Stock Is Falling. Cathie Wood Bought More Stock.
summary: Nvidia  stock was inching down Tuesday, a day after  Cathie Wood’s  ARK Invest disclosed increased stakes in the chip maker.  On Monday, Wood’s funds bought 23,211  Nvidia  shares—worth around $4.2 million at the close—across two exchange-traded funds, the  and the the  according to ARK’s daily trade file.  Nvidia represents 2.7% of both funds, as the 13th and 14th largest holding, respectively.

headline: Nvidia Slips As AMD, Super Micro Earnings Loom; Is Nvidia A Buy Or Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia slipped on Tuesday as investors awaited earnings from its artificial intelligence chip rival Advanced Micro Devices.  Another key earnings report from Super Micro Computer is also awaited at market close.  Investors will look for Advanced Micro Devices to post a decline in second-quarter adjusted earnings to 48 cents a share but a 27% revenue increase to $7.4 billion, according to MarketSurge data.

headline: Ubilink, Zettabyte, and WiAdvance Collaborate to Advance AI Computing in Taiwan
summary: WiAdvance Technology, an innovative cloud service provider under the Wistron Group, and Zettabyte Technology Corporation, a software solutions provider specializing in Zsuite, jointly announced today that they are initiating a collaborative evaluation with Ubilink.AI, a leading AI supercomputing company. The three parties aim to establish a strategic partnership to enhance overall performance and application value in AI computing services.

headline: MSI Showcases DC-MHS and MGX Server Platforms for Cloud-Scale and AI Infrastructure at OCP APAC 2025
summary: At OCP APAC 2025 (Booth S04), MSI, a global leader in high-performance server solutions, presents modular server platforms for modern data center needs. The lineup includes AMD DC-MHS servers for 21" ORv3 and 19" EIA racks, built for scalable and energy-efficient cloud infrastructure, and a NVIDIA MGX-based GPU server optimized for high-density AI workloads such as LLM training and inference. These platforms demonstrate how MSI is powering what's next in computing with open, modular, and workloa

headline: Kratsios: US Is Exploring Ways to Track Flow of AI Chips
summary: Michael Kratsios, Director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, says the US is exploring ways to equip chips with better location-tracking capabilities, as the White House looks to curtail the flow of advanced chips made by the likes of Nvidia to China. He speaks with Haslinda Amin and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".

raw.headline: Kratsios: US Is Exploring Ways to Track Flow of AI Chips

He speaks with Haslinda Amin and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".
